alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 3:20PM CDT until August 10 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH... At 320 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen with the heaviest amounts estimated to fall north of LA-190 and just east of Baton-Rouge Airport. Rainfall rates have diminished in the past 30 minutes but rates up to 1 inch in 30 minutes are still possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Oak Hills Place, Merrydale, Brownfields, Westminster, Inniswold and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 159 and 162. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 4 and 7. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...3-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
